com.uilian.crossover.format

Class NumberShortScaleFormatter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.uilian.crossover.format.NumberShortScaleFormatter

  • public class NumberShortScaleFormatter
extends java.lang.Object
    Number formatter that converts numeric types and returns a truncated "prettified" string using short scale numbers.
    See Also:
    "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Long_and_short_scales"

      • NumberShortScaleFormatter

        public NumberShortScaleFormatter()

    • Method Detail

      • format

        public static java.lang.String format(java.lang.Number input)
                               throws NumberShortScaleFormatterException
        This method returns a prettified version of numbers greater than 6 digits and support millions, billions and trillions.
        Parameters:
        input - The number to be formatted.
        Returns:
        If the number is equal or greater than 1E+6, a string short scale formatted string representing the number. If the number is equal or bigger than 1E+15, it will return an exception. Otherwise a string representation of the number itself will be returned.
        Throws:
        NumberShortScaleFormatterException
